description: From German Leukämie, from Ancient Greek λευκός (leukós, “white”) + αἷμα (haîma, “blood”); surface analysis, leuk- +‎ -emia.

entries.meaning: Any of a class of types of cancer affecting the blood cells, especially the white blood cells (usually with massive leukocytosis), and the blood cell–forming (hematopoietic) tissues.
examples: The subjects suffered from lymphoblastic and myeloid leukemias.
